title: For Trade:  S&W Mod 65-3 in 357 mag w/extras

I would rate its bright stainless finish at 99% with just a very few small handling marks. It is the classic 357 magnum six shot revolver that will also shoot 38 special and 38+P. It is a pre-lock model with fixed sights, 4" heavy barrel, and new compact Pachmayr Gripper Pro grips with open backstrap. Action is typical S&W smooth and tight. Serial number dates to 1985. Comes in S&W factory hard case with like new Roy's Leather RH pancake belt holster with thumb break and HKS speedloader. This will make an excellent house gun. I have two of these so I'm looking to trade one for something more compact for concealed carry.

title: For Sale:  Bushmaster M4 Shorty Carbine XM15-E2S A3, collapsible stock, mags
postcontent:
2005 birth date confirmed by Bushmaster
M4 Shorty Carbine
The rifle is 100% Bushmaster and original parts, except the mags
Chambered in 5.56, also suitable for .223 (not all ARs are suitable for 5.56 - this one is marked 5.56 by Bushmaster)
Collapsible / tele stock
Removable front handle
Comes with plastic hard-side Bushmaster case
Comes with (4) 30 round magazines (Colt, Kay and PMAG - 1 is marked restricted / LE only) and (1) Bushmaster 15 round magazine - the only parts not original

Removable carry handle with flip small / large aperture, elevation, windage adjustments. Picatinny rail flat top.

I also have a Sight Mark red-dot removable sight with multiple modes that can be added to the deal as an upgrade.

This one also has what is known as a “low shelf” receiver. Most civilian AR-15 models will have a “high shelf” meaning that the metal has not been carved out, like it normally would be on an M-16. A low shelf is desirable because it allows for addition of a “DIAS” or “drop in auto sear”, which allows the gun to operate in full auto mode. Civilians can legally buy DIAS units, but only those that were manufactured prior to 1986, and only those that are registered with the ATF, with the approval of your local sheriff.

title: For Sale:  1941 SA M1 Garand
postcontent:
This is a great 1941 M1 garand by SA. The trigger guard, bolt, and internals are all SA. The trigger guard is correct for the date of the rifle. It has NM op rod. The stock is original, untouched, with excellent cartouches, and a great color to it.  
I believe the muzzle reads a 1 and the throat a 3.
The rifle has always been kept clean, properly greased, and well cared for. I have no doubts that if you will be as happy with this rifle as I have been.
I'm thinning out my collection a little to pay bills and maybe another toy if the better half doesn't find out about it. 
This one shoots a little better than my 43' SA, and looks a little nicer, but I have more of a sentimental attachment to that one. 
I will be sad to see it go, but it's time to move on. This is a great for any re-enactors wanting to be as authentic as possible for earlier battles. It will also make a great rifle for as issued shooting competitions. 

The picture might be a little dark to show the good detail and quality of the rifle. If you want a different picture I can try to use a simple photo editor to brighten the color enough to see it better. Dark, aged, walnut tends to be hard to photograph.

The only trades I might consider are antique firearms, but I prefer cash, or at least trade + cash. I've been looking for a Colt 1903 hammerless (.32ACP) for a while. M1 carbines, P-38s, C96, and lugers also interest me, but I would have to do a little more research on the lugers to be sure a fair deal is worked out. You can always offer some kind of trade, and the worst I can say is no.

I communicate by email unless we are planning a meeting in which case sometimes it is easier to contact via texting, or phone call. I'm usually busy during the day, so I may not respond until after 5pm some days. I don't meet at any residence. I only meet in public places. If you want me to ship then I will receive payment first, wait for it to clear the bank, and then you will also cover shipping costs. Only after that will I consider shipping. I prefer local FTF. If someone wants it FTF, they have preference over anyone wanting to ship. I just don't need the extra hassle with as busy as I am.
Thanks for looking and feel free to contact me with questions.

I have put on an oversized tactical bolt handle, bipod, scope rail, Vortex 6 lug 30mm rings, and a Millett TRS-1 4-16x50 illuminated reticle scope. It comes with the iron sights that came off of it as well.  Selling for $850, located in Beattyville.
